overview: This subject introduces students to the basic concepts of bioengineering and signal processing relevant to electrophysiological measures used in audiology; the measurement and analysis of the auditory brainstem response; the theory and application of basic vestibular assessment including patient history and the Caloric, Vestibular Myogenic Evoked Potential (VEMP) and Hallpike tests; and the theory and application of Otoacoustic Emission (OAE) testing.

necessary pre-requisite: For students completing 1st Year prior to 2021
additional pre-requisite: For students completing 1st Year from 2021 onwards

assessments.description: Written exam. 1 hours. Hurdle requirement:. Students must pass the written examination in order to pass this subject overall.
6 online MCQ tests (5 minutes each), Weeks 2,4,6,8,10,12. 30 minutes (total)
Group case presentation (group size around 6 students, requiring 1-2 hours preparation per student). 10 minutes

Semester 2.Contact hours: 28 hours of lectures, tutorials and practical sessions.

Related Handbook entries: This subject contributes to the following:
Available to Study Abroad and/or Study E: This subject is available to students studying at the University from eligible overseas institutions on exchange and study abroad. Students are required to satisfy any listed requirements, such as pre- and co-requisites, for enrolment in the subject.
